attributes.title: Rogers White Sugar
attributes.description:
Sugar is a key ingredient in most food. Most people use sugar on a daily basis without thinking about how it got into their cupboard. Most sugar that is consumed in Canada comes from Rogers Sugar.
Rogers Sugar is one part of a larger corporation, Lantic, Inc.  The Lantic, Inc trade name is used in eastern Canada and Rogers Sugar name is used in western Canada. There are four refining mills spread across Canada that Lantic, Inc. runs. This company products include granulated,
icing, cube, yellow and brown sugars, as well as specialty sugars.
This source map shows how white sugar is produced through two refining process. The two refining process create the same product but the natural source is different, one process uses sugar beets and the other uses sugar cane. The four mills that are operated by Lantic, Inc. are for one specific refining process.
Rogers Sugar continues to supply Canada, and exports to 70 other countries as of 2012.

Lantic, Inc. is the incorporation of Rogers Sugar and Lantic, Sugar. This company is the main contributor of sugar products within Canada, as well as exports their products globally. As of the 2012 fiscal year, Lantic, Inc. was worth around 60 million Canadian dollars (Annual Report, Lantic.ca).
attributes.address: 4026 Rue Notre-Dame Est, Montreal, QC H1W 2K3, Canada
attributes.title: Lantic, Inc.

attributes.description: Australia is currently the third largest country to produce sugar cane. It exports roughly 80% of all produce that is grown. The Australian cane industry produces 30-35 million tonnes of cane per year, which when processed, equates to around 4-4.5 million tonnes of sugar (Cane Growing in Australia, canegrowers.com.au).
attributes.title: Australian Sugar Cane Growers
Montreal Refinery
attributes.address: 4026 Rue Notre-Dame Est, Montreal, QC H1W 2K3, Canada
attributes.description:
This mill refines cane sugar that produces granulated sugar of various types; icing sugar, liquid sugar and soft sugar. Molasses is sold as a by-product of the refining operation Lantic, Inc.(Canadian Sugar Instritute, 1981). Sugar cane is sent to the mill from a variety of different places, such as Australia,Central and South America.
The mill itself was started in 1888 but has gone through many upgrades throughout the years. Before being purchased by Lantic, Inc in 1984 it was operated by St. Lawrence Sugar (Schreiner, 1989). Under Lantic, Inc and as a result of major upgrading this mill can refine anywhere between 440,00 tonnes and 600, 000 tonnes of cane sugar per year.

attributes.title: Central America Sugar Cane Growers
attributes.description: There are many countries that sugar cane come from in this region, the main exporters for Lantic, Inc. are Nicaragua, The Dominican Republic, Cuba, Guyana, Jamaica (Canadian Sugar Institute).

attributes.title: Vancouver Refinery
attributes.address: 123 Rogers Street, Vancouver, BC V6A, Canada
attributes.description:
The Vancouver plant can refine into 240,000 tonnes of sugar per year. The total annual production is dependent on market requirements and on the production from the Taber beet sugar factory (Facilities, Lantic.ca). 
This mill was the original site for Rogers Sugar which began production in 1891 (Schreiner, 1989).

attributes.title: Taber Refinery
attributes.description: This plant is used only to process the sugar beets that are from Alberta and can process around 6,000 tonnes of beets per day. The plant has 120 permanent employees and usually hired another 120 employees during sugar beet processing period, which is during the fall. As of 2010 the hourly rate these temporary employees would expect is between $13.39 and $14.48.

attributes.title: Sales and Distribution Centre
attributes.address: 198 New Toronto Street, Toronto, ON M8V 1Y1, Canada
attributes.description:
This facility is used as for storing the sugar products before it is to be sent all over the world. This is where all sale orders come in and are processed. Refined sugar is shipped mainly by railcar from the Montreal plant to the Toronto distribution centre (Facilities, Lantic. ca). 
In nearby facilities, blending operations are in place in case an order comes in that has specific instructions, or requirements regarding the type of sugar it needs.

attributes.title: South America Sugar Cane Growers
attributes.description: Brazil is currently the largest producer and exporter of sugar cane. Although it still exports sugar cane to be refined into sugar, the main purpose of the sugar cane industry is to create a clean, renewable fuel (The Industry-Background, english.unica.com.br).

attributes.title: Alberta Beet Sugar Growers
attributes.description: Lantic, Inc. contracts around 400 different sugar beet farms in Alberta, each farm produces allots a specific number of acres each year just to grow sugar beets to be sent to the refinery mill in Tabar, Alberta. These contracts depend on how the market value of sugar and whether conditions are doing throughout the previous year, and any estimates made for the following year.  As such, farmers may also have contracts between other companies that may wish to but beet sugar, or other produce that may be grown on the land (asbg.ca).
